title: Pasta Roni Recipe
description: Homemade pasta roni is a quick and easy midweek meal.

About Us The Allrecipes Allstars How to Add a Recipe GET THE MAGAZINE Never lose a recipe: Join MyRecipes to save and find favorites from AR & beyond Recipes Main Dishes Pasta Homemade Pasta Roni 4.8 (12) 11 Reviews 4 Photos Call it a childhood craving, dorm room gourmet, or simply a grocery store pantry staple, but homemade angel hair pasta with herbs is just as tasty and fast to make! There's no denying the simplicity. Submitted by thedailygourmet Published on February 2, 2023 Save Rate Print Share Close Add Photo 4 4 4 Prep Time: 5 mins Cook Time: 10 mins Total Time: 15 mins Servings: 2 Jump to Nutrition Facts Cook Mode (Keep screen awake) Ingredients 1x 2x 4x Oops! Something went wrong. Our team is working on it. Original recipe (1X) yields 2 servings 2 cups chicken broth 3 ounces angel hair pasta 1 tablespoon butter 1 clove garlic, minced ½ teaspoon Italian seasoning ¼ cup heavy cream ¾ cup finely shredded Parmesan cheese 1 teaspoon minced fresh parsley, or to taste Directions Bring chicken broth in a saucepan to a boil over medium-high heat. Cook angel hair pasta in the boiling broth, stirring occasionally, until tender yet firm to the bite, 4 to 5 minutes. Drain pasta, reserving 1/4 cup of chicken broth. Melt butter in a saucepan over medium-low heat; add garlic and cook until fragrant, about 30 seconds. Stir in Italian seasoning, reserved 1/4 cup chicken broth, and whipping cream. Add Parmesan cheese and stir until melted. Stir in angel hair pasta; toss to coat. Garnish with freshly minced parsley. Cook's Notes: I use a microplane grater to finely shred the Parmesan cheese. 1/4 cup Parmesan cheese will be about 24 grams of freshly grated Parmesan cheese. I Made It Print Nutrition Facts (per serving) 423 Calories 27g Fat 28g Carbs 18g Protein Show Full Nutrition Label Hide Full Nutrition Label Nutrition Facts Servings Per Recipe 2 Calories 423 % Daily Value * Total Fat 27g 34% Saturated Fat 16g 79% Cholesterol 84mg 28% Sodium 1818mg 79% Total Carbohydrate 28g 10% Dietary Fiber 2g 8% Protein 18g 36% Potassium 224mg 5% * Percent Daily Values are based on a 2,000 calorie diet. Add Your Photo Photos of Homemade Pasta Roni 01 of 04 Photo by  thedailygourmet 02 of 04 Photo by  TrendyBroth2949 03/06/2024 A keeper! Great flavors Easy to follow Worth the effort Family favorite Crowd-pleaser This is one of our new favorites! We have all the ingredients on hand so it's easy to whip up. I just had to cook my noodles a bit longer than 4-5 minutes for them to be done. I also used whole milk instead of heavy cream because it's what I had available. Turned out great! I am going to double the recipe next time! New favorite and my husband and toddler loved it too! 03 of 04 Photo by  mnerney 02/24/2024 I was a little skeptical about this recipe's ability to recreate the classic comfort food taste of Pasta Roni, but it was spot on! I found the sauce was a little soupy and would reduce the chicken broth added back in to 1/8 cup. Otherwise, this was a great college throwback! 04 of 04 Photo by  DREGINEK 02/20/2023 Really easy and really good. I doubled and maybe I’m a cheapskate but didn’t have the heart to “waste” all but 1/2c chicken broth. So I boiled in plain water and then added some chicken boullion granules to the reserved pasta water. In hindsight, maybe that’s what gives it more flavor? I also used real grated Parmesan which, while stirring frequently on medium heat, still clumped up but! As I said, really good and really simple/easy to make! Thanks thedailygourmet! 1 You’ll Also Love Shrimp Pasta with Lemon-Butter Sauce Greek Yogurt Carbonara 9 Ratings Quick and Easy Chicken Spaghetti 257 Ratings Old Bay Shrimp and Pasta Alfredo 7 Ratings Pasta with Asparagus 300 Ratings Delicious Angel Hair Pasta 13 Ratings Angel Hair Pasta with Lemon and Chicken (Lighter) 41 Ratings Lemon Shrimp Pasta 4 Ratings Pasta Con Sarde (Pasta with Sardines) 45 Ratings Easy Ranch Spaghetti Carbonara Spaghetti Carbonara I 49 Ratings Quick Angel Hair with Basil Cream for One 48 Ratings Rich Pasta for the Poor Kitchen 190 Ratings Champagne Shrimp and Pasta 644 Ratings Creamy Cajun Shrimp Pasta 458 Ratings Avocado Carbonara for Two 2 Ratings Allrecipes Newsletters Follow Us Dinners Meals Ingredients Occasions Cuisines Kitchen Tips News Features About Us Editorial Process Privacy Policy Product Vetting Terms of Service Advertise Careers Contact Your Privacy Choices   Allrecipes is part of the Dotdash Meredith publishing family. name: thedailygourmet
instructions: Bring chicken broth in a saucepan to a boil over medium-high heat. Cook angel hair pasta in the boiling broth, stirring occasionally, until tender yet firm to the bite, 4 to 5 minutes.;Drain pasta, reserving 1/4 cup of chicken broth.;Melt butter in a saucepan over medium-low heat; add garlic and cook until fragrant, about 30 seconds. Stir in Italian seasoning, reserved 1/4 cup chicken broth, and whipping cream. Add Parmesan cheese and stir until melted.;Stir in angel hair pasta; toss to coat. Garnish with freshly minced parsley.
